results.byline: By Kim Severson and Julia Moskin
results.title: Julie Powell, Food Writer Known for ‘Julie & Julia,’ Dies at 49
results.abstract: She documented her attempt to cook every recipe in Julia Child’s “Mastering the Art of French Cooking” in a popular blog that became a best-selling book and a hit movie.

media.caption: Julie Powell in 2009, the year Nora Ephron's movie “Julie & Julia,” based on Ms. Powell’s book, was released.
media.copyright: Kelly Campbell, via Little, Brown & Company

results.title: Libertarian Candidate Drops Out of Arizona Senate Race and Endorses Masters
results.abstract: “This is another major boost of momentum as we consolidate our support,” Blake Masters said.

media.caption: Marc Victor, center, with Blake Masters, right, and Senator Mark Kelly during their only debate, in October.

results.title: Idaho Man Convicted in 1984 Murder of 12-Year-Old Colorado Girl
results.abstract: The long-unsolved kidnapping and killing of Jonelle Matthews haunted the community of Greeley, about 50 miles north of Denver.

media.caption: Steve Pankey during his trial last year, which ended in a mistrial. On Monday, a jury found him guilty of murder and kidnapping.

results.title: Education Department Expands Student Loan Relief Programs
results.abstract: A lengthy set of rule changes will reduce the total cost for many federal student loan borrowers and ease rules for debt elimination.

media.caption: New rules from the Education Department come as President Biden’s student debt relief plan faces legal challenges.
media.copyright: Al Drago for The New York Times

results.title: Tropical Storm Lisa Is Expected to Become a Hurricane in the Caribbean
results.abstract: The storm was forecast to pass near or over the Bay Islands in Honduras before approaching Belize on Wednesday and southeastern Mexico on Thursday.

media.caption: A satellite image of Tropical Storm Lisa on Tuesday.

results.title: Tropical Storm Martin to Become a Hurricane on Wednesday
results.abstract: Martin became the second named storm to develop in two days, with Tropical Storm Lisa moving west across the western Caribbean.

media.caption: Tropical Storm Martin, which formed on Tuesday, did not pose an immediate threat to land.

results.title: Is It Better to Brush Your Teeth Before Breakfast or After?
results.abstract: It’s a hotly debated question in dentistry.

results.title: Parkland Families Express Rage and Grief at Gunman’s Sentencing
results.abstract: The gunman who killed 17 people at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School is scheduled to be sentenced to life in prison without parole.

media.caption: Anthony Montalto was embraced by his father, Tony, after speaking at a sentencing hearing for the gunman who killed his sister, Gina.
media.copyright: Pool photo by Amy Beth Bennett

results.byline: By Lola Fadulu and Nate Schweber
results.title: Takeaways from first day of the Trump Organization trial in Manhattan.
results.abstract: Prosecutors said the Trump Organization and another family business concealed lavish perks given to its top executives in a scheme to avoid paying taxes. Defense lawyers argued the executives acted on their own in their personal interest and the businesses did not benefit.

media.caption: Michael van der Veen, left, a defense attorney, arrives Monday for the first day of the Trump Organization trial.

results.title: What to Do if You Find Yourself in a Crowd Crush
results.abstract: While tragedies such as the deaths of 151 people at a Halloween event in Seoul are rare, anyone attending a big gathering should keep these safety tips in mind, experts say.

results.adx_keywords: Seoul Halloween Stampede (2022);Stampedes;Subways;Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Deaths (Fatalities);Halloween;Police;Yoon Suk-yeol;Seoul (South Korea);South Korea
results.title: Halloween Crowd Crush in Seoul Was ‘Absolutely Avoidable,’ Experts Say
results.abstract: Days after the deaths of more than 150 young people, officials were still struggling to explain what exactly went wrong and who was to blame.

media.caption: Mourners on Monday gathered at a makeshift memorial to the victims of a crowd crush in Seoul on Saturday night.
media.copyright: Chang W. Lee/The New York Times

results.title: The Facts About the Attack on Paul Pelosi, According to Prosecutors
results.abstract: The attack has caused alarm about the threat of violence to elected officials, and has also become the focus of baseless conspiracy theories.

media.caption: Police officers near Nancy Pelosi’s home in San Francisco after the attack.

results.title: Fourteen People, Including Three Children, Are Wounded in Chicago Shooting
results.abstract: The victims were attending a vigil near the city’s West Side when the shooting occurred, the police said.

media.caption: Two people were in critical condition after a shooting on Chicago’s West Side on Monday in which 14 people were injured, the authorities said. Three children, including a 3-year-old boy, were in serious condition.

results.title: Republicans Continue to Spread Baseless Claims About Pelosi Attack
results.abstract: Some of the conspiracy theories have already seeped into the Republican mainstream.

media.caption: Paul Pelosi, the husband of House Speaker Nancy Pelosi, was attacked in the couple’s San Francisco home on Friday by an intruder asking, “Where is Nancy?”

results.title: ‘Planet Killer’ Asteroid Spotted That Poses Distant Risk to Earth
results.abstract: The space rock had been hidden by the glare of the sun, suggesting that more large asteroids are in a solar system region difficult to study from Earth.

media.caption: The Dark Energy Camera at the Víctor M. Blanco 4-meter Telescope in Chile was used to aid the detection of asteroids that orbit between Earth and the sun and are otherwise difficult to spot.

results.title: Top Democrats Question Their Party’s Strategy as Midterm Worries Grow
results.abstract: Leading lawmakers and strategists are openly doubting the party’s kitchen-sink approach, saying Democrats have failed to unite around one central message.

media.caption: Abortion rights demonstrators prepared for an event last month in Madison, Wis., hosted by Gov. Tony Evers, a Democrat who is in a tight race for re-election.

results.adx_keywords: Furniture;Real Estate and Housing (Residential);Sustainable Living;Shopping and Retail;E-Commerce;Corporate Social Responsibility;Ikea;Fernished Inc;Wayfair Inc
results.title: ‘Fast Furniture’ Is Cheap. And Americans Are Throwing It in the Trash.
results.abstract: The mass-produced furniture that sold furiously during the pandemic could soon be clogging landfills.

media.caption: Consumers spent $4 billion from 2019 to 2021 on furniture in the United States. Environmentalists say that a lot of the products sold during the pandemic weren’t built to last.
media.copyright: John Taggart for The New York Times.

results.byline: By Liam Stack, Tracey Tully and Sarah Maslin Nir
results.title: 2 Newark Police Officers Shot While Responding to 911 Call, Officials Say
results.abstract: Their injuries were not life threatening. The suspected shooter remained at large on Tuesday evening.

media.caption: The police taped off several blocks of Chancellor Avenue where the shooting occurred, and emergency vehicles swarmed the scene on Tuesday afternoon.
media.copyright: Bryan Anselm for The New York Times

results.byline: By Luke Broadwater, Annie Karni and Emily Cochrane
results.title: Police Cameras at Pelosi’s House Were Unmonitored as They Caught Break-In
results.abstract: Minutes went by before any Capitol Police officer reviewed the footage. Law enforcement leaders said they planned to beef up protections for members of Congress.

media.caption: Many lawmakers say it has long been clear that Capitol security officials must do more to protect them.
media.copyright: Shuran Huang for The New York Times
